intro: Malus dasyphylla f. dioeca, commonly known as the dwarf apple tree, is a compact, ornamental variety of the apple tree. It is characterized by its small size, typically reaching only a few feet in height, making it suitable for small gardens or containers. The plant features showy white flowers that appear in early spring, followed by small, edible apples that ripen in late summer. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, providing visual interest throughout the growing season. This variety is valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a range of soil conditions.
